subject: Re: [junit] How to print out names of test cases in testrunner?
msgSnippet: ... _JUnit Recipes_ has a specific recipe on this topic, which I have uploaded to the file section of this list. If the recipe helps you, then buy the book!
messageBody:
geziefer wrote:
> Hi there,
>
> we have a number of test classes, each containing several test
> methods. The developers add methods to these classes continuously. All
> test classes are combined in a testsuite, which runs with
> junit.textui.TestRunner in a batch script.
>
> What I would need to see in the output of that script is the name of
> each test method which was executed. I want to avoid, that each method
> should printout its name, but solve it automatically.
>
> What could I do here?

_JUnit Recipes_ has a specific recipe on this topic, which I have
uploaded to the file section of this list. If the recipe helps you, then
buy the book!

Take care.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com
2005 Gordon Pask Award Winner for contribution to Agile practice
Author, JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
